title: How Trump Deflected MAGA’s Wrath Over Epstein, at Least for Now
summary: By tapping into other grievances, President Trump managed to turn one of the most fractious moments for his base into a unifying one.

title: An Accuser’s Story Suggests How Trump Might Appear in the Epstein Files
summary: A former Jeffrey Epstein employee said that she told the F.B.I. in 1996 and 2006 about what she considered a troubling encounter with Donald J. Trump.

title: Republicans and Democrats Call for More Information on Epstein Case
summary: Members of Congress from both parties said they wanted to see more files released, while President Trump has encouraged his base to move on.

title: Harvard’s Face-Off With the White House, and a Disturbing Pattern in Organ Donations
summary: Plus, pop music and sign language.

title: 2 Deadly Shootings in 2 Days Highlight Dangers of Aid Distribution in Gaza
summary: On Saturday, Israeli soldiers shot Palestinians near an Israel-backed food site. On Sunday, they fired at people gathering near a U.N. convoy. Both incidents were symptoms of broader problems.

title: Israel Refuses to Renew Visa of Top UN Humanitarian Official for Gaza
summary: The head of the agency that helps oversee aid deliveries to the territory had previously criticized the impact of Israeli military attacks on civilians.

title: Trump Administration and Harvard Face Crucial Court Test
summary: A hearing in Boston on Monday is expected to shape the future of negotiations between the White House and the nation’s oldest university.

title: Disabled Americans Fear What Medicaid Cuts Could Do to Them
summary: The White House says roughly $1 trillion in Medicaid cuts won’t limit home- and community-based care. Health care experts disagree.

title: An Attack on the Medical Establishment Buried in an 1,800-Page Regulation
summary: If approved, a new rule could end the entrenched pay advantages for specialists like surgeons over other doctors.

title: Trump Urges Washington and Cleveland Sports Teams to Revert to Former Names
summary: The president threatened to block a deal for the Washington Commanders’ new stadium if the team did not bow to his demand.

title: How Trump’s Tariffs and Foreign Policies Have Bolstered Support for the E.U.
summary: The European Union has its problems, but the bloc is gaining public trust and making new friends. President Trump’s attacks are one reason why.

title: China’s Hardball Tactics Set Tone for Difficult Summit with Europe
summary: Beijing is betting that economic pressure and diplomatic defiance will force concessions, but its stance could put more strain on its ties with Europe at a crucial time.

title: Iran to Hold Nuclear Talks With European Governments
summary: Iranian representatives will meet with negotiators from Britain, France and Germany on Friday, days after they threatened to restore sanctions.

title: Ukraine Ups Its Arms Production, Asking Allies to Pay for It
summary: There is a growing drive to make the country more self-reliant in weapons manufacturing as it faces Russia’s superior firepower. That requires a lot of money from Western backers.

title: Russia Strikes Ukraine With Missiles and Drones
summary: The strikes appear to have been the most intense since President Trump announced a new plan last week to send weapons to Ukraine.

title: Italy Cancels Valery Gergiev’s Festival Appearance
summary: Some lawmakers in Italy had argued that Valery Gergiev’s planned appearance sent the wrong message as Europe strives to remain united in its support for Ukraine.

title: Bangladesh Military Plane Crashes Into School, Killing at Least 19
summary: Dozens were injured after the aircraft crashed in Dhaka, Bangladesh’s capital, according to national fire officials.

title: How Did the Number of Missing After Texas Floods Drop So Drastically?
summary: Last week, officials said 97 people were missing in Kerr County. Now, it’s down to three. The drop is substantial, but such wild fluctuations can happen after disasters.

title: Chinese Officials Helped Cover Up Lead Poisoning of Children, Report Says
summary: Health officials tampered with blood tests of some of the more than 200 children who were sickened by food tainted with lead, an investigation found.

title: Dolly Parton Musical’s Nashville Debut Draws Flocks of Fans
summary: Parton’s life and career have always been rooted in Tennessee. For her fans, it was only fitting to see the debut of her biographical musical here, too.

title: Opinion: The Path to Peace in the Middle East (and a Nobel Prize for Trump)
summary: A possible path to peace in the Middle East.

title: Ben Bernanke and Janet Yellen: The Fed Must Be Independent
summary: Political pressure interferes with a mandate to work for stable prices and maximum employment.

title: A.I. vs. A.I.
summary: We examine how the technology is being used against itself.

title: Alaska Airlines Resumes Operations After IT Outage
summary: Alaska Airlines said it had ended the ground stop, which lasted about three hours and resulted from a software outage. “Residual impacts” to its operations were likely, it said.

title: Obesity Prediction Could Be Guided by Genetic Risk Scores
summary: Researchers hope that a better understanding of which genes contribute to excess weight could help with prevention starting in childhood.

title: Venezuela Targets Economists as Inflation Surges Under Trump’s Sanctions
summary: As inflation surges under President Trump’s renewed sanctions, Venezuelan authorities are trying to keep a lid on the country’s worsening financial situation.

title: Kenneth Colley, 87, ‘Star Wars’ Actor With a Commanding Presence, Dies
summary: A fixture onscreen and onstage, he became a fan favorite as Darth Vader’s ally, Admiral Piett, in “The Empire Strikes Back” and “Return of the Jedi.”
